The many contradictory opinions in regard to what the Bible teaches do not arise from any obscurity in the book itself, but from blindness and prejudice on 
                                                                           24
the part of interpreters. Men ignore the plain statements of the Bible to follow their own perverted  reason. Priding themselves on their intellectual  attainments, they overlook the simplicity of truth; they forsake the fountain of living waters to drink of the poisonous stream of error.--Review and Herald, Jan. 27, 1885.
